p: The aims of the work programme were for the fellow to i) gain experience in performing risk assessment of ‘other substances’ used in food supplements or fortified foods, with a focus on substances of plant origin (‘botanicals’, i.e. plant preparations and secondary plant compounds); ii) to specifically assess the possible health risks associated with the consumption of Annona muricata‐based food supplements; and iii) to set up further networking and build professional collaboration with the host institution, as well as with other experts in various fields of food risk assessment.
